meanings.sent1: She hustled to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel hustled across the park to find nuts.
meanings.sent3: The little rabbit hustled to finish its carrot before the others.
meanings.sent4: Time hustled by like a fast train, leaving memories in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The wind hustled through the trees, carrying whispers of the forest.

meanings.definition: To obtain by forceful action or persuasion
meanings.sent1: He hustled his way into getting the last ticket for the show.
meanings.sent2: The bully hustled the smaller kids out of their lunch money.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox hustled the chickens into giving up their eggs.
meanings.sent4: She hustled the information from the reluctant witness.
meanings.sent5: The determined detective hustled the truth out of the suspect.

meanings.definition: To engage in energetic activity or work
meanings.sent1: The team hustled to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The ants hustled together to build their anthill.
meanings.sent3: The kids hustled to clean up the mess before their parents came home.
meanings.sent4: The bees hustled from flower to flower, collecting nectar.
meanings.sent5: The workers hustled all day to complete the construction on time.

meanings.sent1: The con artist hustled the old man out of his savings.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that she had been hustled into buying a fake watch.
meanings.sent3: The tricky magician hustled the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The smooth talker hustled his way into getting free drinks all night.
meanings.sent5: The scammer hustled unsuspecting victims with promises of easy money.
